# Wavelets problems 

## Problem Set 1.1

1. Suppose the only nonzero components of $x$ and $h$ are $x(0) = 1$,
 $x(1) = 3$, $h(0) = 1/2$, and $h(1) = 1/2$. Compute the outputs
 $y(n)$. Verify in the frequency domain that $Y(\omega) =
 H(\omega)X(\omega)$.
